revised_title: Royal Society Empire Scientific Conference: A Review of the 1946 Event
tldr: The Royal Society Empire Scientific Conference of 1946 brought together scientists from the United Kingdom and its colonies to discuss and promote scientific collaboration, exchange ideas, and improve the organization of scientific research. The conference covered various topics, including general scientific organization, natural products, and the future of scientific liaison offices. Delegates attended lectures, visited research facilities, and participated in informal discussions on diverse subjects.
